    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public DryOpts parse(java.lang.String... args)

      • is_shortOpt

        public DryOpts.Builder is_shortOpt(java.lang.String shortOpt_regex)
        Only characters that match regex can be short options. Default value is "\\p{L}", which matches any letter

      • integer_shortOpts

        public DryOpts.Builder integer_shortOpts()
        Digits can be options, this makes it impossible to enter negative numbers as positional arguments. is equal to is_shortOpt("[-\\d\\p{Letter}]")

      • uppercase_shortOpt_ends_list

        public DryOpts.Builder uppercase_shortOpt_ends_list(boolean b)
        if set, uppercase shortOpts take the rest of the argument as its argument even if the next char isn't '=' but a valid shortOpt. this means -fAfa is flag f and A has argument fa Default value is false.

      • stop_at_first_nonOpt

        public DryOpts.Builder stop_at_first_nonOpt()
        Turns the --option in "-q command --option" into an argument. Note that you now must enter options requiring an argument as --file=path; DryOpts doesn't know -q is a flag until it's added, and then optFlag("option") would already have returned true.

      • name

        public DryOpts.Builder name(java.lang.String name)
        for the Usage: line.
